message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of placing guards on a terrain, which is a classic problem in computational geometry and falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG). The algorithm is based on rounding a linear programming relaxation, which suggests that it could also fall under the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The use of LP relaxation and approximation algorithms also suggests that it could belong to the category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also mentions the weighted and partial versions of the problem, which suggests that it could belong to the category of game theory (cs.GT) or machine learning (cs.LG).
